intro: Odontadenia neglecta, commonly known as the slender lomatium, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
